race.name: The Gralloch
race.tagline: Scottish Highlands ultra—200km of remote terrain, 3,500m elevation, brutal weather, 25-35% DNF.

climate.description: September: 8-18°C, 40% rain chance, autumn conditions, hypothermia risk.

terrain.surface: 75% gravel, 25% singletrack/dirt. Scottish Highlands—remote terrain, technical sections. 200 km ultra distance (12-18 hours). 3,500 m elevation. Technical rating: 4/5. Self-sufficient required.

biased_opinion.summary: The Gralloch is Scottish Highlands ultra—200 km, 3,500 m elevation. Founded ~2017. 75% gravel, 25% singletrack/dirt. Remote Highlands terrain, technical sections. 200-300 riders. September autumn conditions (8-18°C, 40% rain). 25-35% DNF. Ultra distance (12-18 hours). Self-sufficient required. If you want Scottish ultra brutality with remote Highlands scenery, this is it. If you want manageable distance or good weather, skip it. Brutal but unique.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: The Gralloch is Scottish Highlands brutality. 200 km, 3,500 m, 40% rain risk, 25-35% DNF. If you want Scottish ultra with remote Highlands scenery, this is it. If you want manageable distance or good weather, skip it. Brutal but unique. Self-sufficient required.

logistics.nearest_airport: Edinburgh (EDI) or Glasgow (GLA) — ~150 km (2-3 hour drive)
logistics.travel_summary: Fly to Edinburgh (EDI) or Glasgow (GLA). Rental car needed (150 km, 2-3 hour drive to Highlands). Remote location—book lodging early. Day-before packet pickup. Race September.
logistics.food_options: Limited aid stations (remote location, self-sufficient required). Post-race party if you finish.

course_description.character: 200 km, 3,500 m. 75% gravel, 25% singletrack/dirt. Scottish Highlands—remote technical terrain. Technical rating: 4/5.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Remote Highlands Terrain
suffering_zones.description: Remote Scottish Highlands. 200 km ultra. 12-18 hours. Self-sufficient required.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Pace conservatively. Carry spares, food, water. Self-sufficient. Long day.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Scottish Weather
suffering_zones.description: September = 40% rain, 8-18°C. Cold + wet = hypothermia risk.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Full waterproofs. Layers. Manage cold/wet. Hypothermia prevention critical.

suffering_zones.name: Mile 150+: Ultra Distance Fatigue
suffering_zones.description: 50 km to go. Legs gone. Mental game critical. 25-35% DNF here.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Break into chunks. Focus on next aid. Mental toughness. Push through.

course_description.signature_challenge: 200 km ultra + Scottish weather (40% rain, cold) + remote Highlands. 25-35% DNF.

history.origin_story: The Gralloch founded ~2017. Scottish Highlands ultra. 200 km, 200-300 riders. Remote terrain. Brutal. Self-sufficient.
history.reputation: Scottish ultra. Remote Highlands. Brutal. 25-35% DNF. Self-sufficient.
